Description: Sixteen oblate spheroid beads strung together as one item by excavator; eight beads are of opaque green glass, almost like faience, with corroded and pitted surfaces; six are matching 'eye' beads with blue and white dots on a green background; two are smaller random eye beads (blue, white and black dots on a green and blue background respectively).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: For eye beads see: Beck, Archaeologia 77 (1928), p. 64 & fig. 62; Etruscan examples Marshall, BM Finger Rings, nos. 1450 and 1452.
Bibliographic references: Bailey & Hockey 2001 / 'New objects' from British Museum Tomb 73 at Curium (p. 111 no. 8 & fig. 9.6)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 83, Tomb 73 no. 12)
